703783f-a.text:
Coney Island Ave., west side, between Glenwood Road and Ave. H. This place was known as the Tunis-Sergen house, and was erected in 1836. If it were in existence in (1937), it would be 20 ft. south of No. 1102 Coney Island Ave., and 50 ft. west of the same Ave. Tunis Bergen occupied it from 1857-1873.
August 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
